text: Not sure if this is the correct forum, and I’m probably using this thing incorrectly, but Julia 1.6 RC1 is giving me a segmentation fault. Instructions for reproducing in comments.

elements.text: Not sure if this is the correct forum, and I’m probably using this thing incorrectly, but Julia 1.6 RC1 is giving me a segmentation fault. Instructions for reproducing in comments.

text:
Code
```using JLD, SnoopCompile, Pkg
tinf = @snoopi_deep Pkg.add("DataFrames")
JLD.save("./shared/tinf.jld", "tinf", tinf)```
Output

elements.text:
using JLD, SnoopCompile, Pkg
tinf = @snoopi_deep Pkg.add("DataFrames")
JLD.save("./shared/tinf.jld", "tinf", tinf)

text:
Dockerfile for the environment I ran it in
```FROM julia:1.6-buster

USER root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash arthur

USER arthur
WORKDIR /home/arthur
ENV PATH="/home/arthur/mambaforge/bin:${PATH}"

RUN set -eux; \
    curl -LJO --output Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh \
    <https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh> \
    && bash Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh -b \
    && rm -f Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh 

RUN set -eux; \
    mamba install -y jupyterlab \
    && mamba clean --all -f -y

RUN julia -e "using Pkg; Pkg.add([\"JLD\",\"SnoopCompile\",\"AbstractTrees\"]); Pkg.precompile();"

CMD ["bash"]```

elements.text: Dockerfile for the environment I ran it in

FROM julia:1.6-buster

USER root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash arthur

USER arthur
WORKDIR /home/arthur
ENV PATH="/home/arthur/mambaforge/bin:${PATH}"

RUN set -eux; \
    curl -LJO --output Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh \

\
    && bash Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh -b \
    && rm -f Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh 

RUN set -eux; \
    mamba install -y jupyterlab \
    && mamba clean --all -f -y

RUN julia -e "using Pkg; Pkg.add([\"JLD\",\"SnoopCompile\",\"AbstractTrees\"]); Pkg.precompile();"

CMD ["bash"]

text: I need some way to save it to a file because the docker environment doesn’t have a GUI, and that directory is shared from host.

elements.text: I need some way to save it to a file because the docker environment doesn’t have a GUI, and that directory is shared from host.

text: Please open a GitHub issue, this does look like a bug

elements.text: Please open a GitHub issue, this does look like a bug
